articles.title: Apple: WWDC 2025 Was A Major Point Of Failure
articles.content: Apple seems lost in a rapidly evolving market environment. Read how AAPL stock is struggling with long-term trends and repeated missteps like WWDC 2025.

articles.title: Week in Review: WWDC 2025 recap
articles.content: Welcome back to Week in Review! We have lots for you this week, including what came out of WWDC 2025; The Browser Company's AI browser; OpenAI's partnership with Mattel; and your iPad might finally be a true work machine.

articles.title: The App Store’s new AI-generated tags are live in the beta
articles.content: Apple’s plans to improve App Store discoverability using AI tagging techniques are now available in the developer beta build of iOS 26. articles.title: JUST: ESG ETF Doing The Job, But Not The Best
articles.content: JUST offers ESG-focused exposure to Russell 1000 stocks with solid fundamentals but trails peers in impact, fees, and volume. Find out why JUST ETF is a hold.

articles.title: Generational Buying Opportunity: Dividend Growth Machines For The AI Boom
articles.content: The AI boom may define the next decade, but most stocks are already priced for perfection. Learn why a few overlooked plays still offer a rare buying opportunity.

articles.title: Apple just made 3 great new privacy and security enhancements—but missed these 3 opportunities
articles.content: iOS 26, iPadOS 26, and macOS 26 will let you keep your data even more secure and private. But Apple could go further.

articles.title: Apple Reroutes 97% Of Foxconn iPhone Exports From India To US Between March And May As Trump Threatens 25% Tariff On Non-US-Made iPhones: Report
articles.content: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) has reportedly increased its iPhone shipments from India to the U.S. in the past few months, as the tech giant moves to protect its U.S. sales from the impact of escalating tariffs on China-made goods. What Happened: Between March and May, 97% of iPhones exported by Foxconn, also known as Hon Hai Precision Industry Co., Ltd (OTC:HNHAF), from India were sent to the U.S., according to customs data reviewed by Reuters. That's a steep jump from the 2024 average of just over

articles.title: Why Superintelligent AI Isn’t Taking Over Anytime Soon
articles.content: Despite claims from top names in AI, researchers argue that fundamental flaws in reasoning models mean bots aren’t on the verge of exceeding human smarts.

articles.title: Why Apple (AAPL) Dipped More Than Broader Market Today
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) reached $196.45 at the closing of the latest trading day, reflecting a -1.38% change compared to its last close.
